description: A large house made entirely of wax created by Mr. 3 using his Doru Doru no Mi powers. Serves as his hideout and base of operations on Little Garden island. Contains a Den Den Mushi for communication with Baroque Works.

keyEvents.title: Sanji Discovers the Candle House
keyEvents.description: Sanji stumbles upon this mysterious wax structure while wandering Little Garden searching for his crewmates.
keyEvents.significance: This discovery leads to Sanji's crucial encounter with Crocodile via Den Den Mushi.

keyEvents.title: Crocodile Calls the Candle House
keyEvents.description: Crocodile calls the Candle House to check on Mr. 3's mission, inadvertently speaking with Sanji instead.
keyEvents.significance: The location becomes the site of the first communication between a Straw Hat and the saga's main antagonist.

statusHistory.reason: Mr. 3's hideout during the Little Garden arc

description: A prehistoric island in Paradise inhabited by dinosaurs and two giant warriors. The island is stuck in the climate of the age of dinosaurs.

keyEvents.title: Usopp's Kaenboshi Debut
keyEvents.description: Usopp uses his Fire Star technique for the first time on Little Garden to free Luffy from hypnosis.
keyEvents.significance: The island becomes the site of an important technique debut.

keyEvents.title: Crew Counterattack Against Baroque Works
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats launch their counterattack against Mr. 3, Mr. 5, Miss Valentine, and Miss Goldenweek on Little Garden.
keyEvents.significance: Major battle concludes with the defeat of multiple Baroque Works officer agents.

keyEvents.title: Wax Structure Destroyed
keyEvents.description: Luffy uses Mr. 3's hair to ignite the rope, creating a ring of fire that destroys the giant wax structure and frees the trapped crew members.
keyEvents.significance: Climactic moment that saves the crew from being turned into wax statues.

statusHistory.reason: Prehistoric island continues to exist with its dinosaur inhabitants
